title: Sri Lanka political crisis hits monetary policy decision
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT  – Sri Lanka’s fast developing political crisis has hit a monetary policy decision and has delayed a possible rate hike after Central Bank Governor Nivard Cabraal resigned.
The central bank said a monetary policy decision which was to have been announced on April 05 would not take place.
The monetary policy meeting was brought forward from April 08, after inflation hit 18.7 percent, though widely expected by outside analysts.
The central bank was expected to hike rates, which would have reduced money printing and domestic private credit.
Analysts had warned of triple defaults unless urgent action is taken to tighten monetary policy and restore a working exchange rate regime. (Colombo/Apr04/2022)
